raw_text:
Edwards tips Idowu for Euro gold
 
 World outdoor triple jump record holder and BBC pundit Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu can take gold at the European Indoor Championships.
 
 Idowu landed 17.30m at the British trials in Sheffield last month to lead the world triple jump rankings. "It's all down to him, but if he jumps as well as he did in Sheffield he could win the gold medal," said Edwards. "His ability is undoubted but all his best performances seem to happen in domestic meetings."
 
 Idowu made his breakthrough five years ago but so far has only a Commonwealth silver medal to his name. Edwards himself kept Idowu off top spot at the Manchester Games. But he believes the European Indoors in Madrid represent a chance for the 26-year-old to prove his credentials as Britain's top triple jumper. "He has to start producing at international level and here is the beginning," said Edwards. "Phillips still needs to be much more consistent. I'm sure a victory in Madrid will build up his confidence and self-belief that he can be best in the world." The qualifying round of the men's triple jump in Madrid takes place on Friday with the final scheduled for Saturday. Olympic champion Christian Olsson will not be taking part as he is out for the entire indoor season with an ankle injury.
llama3.2:1b: Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu can win gold at the European Indoor Championships. Idowu landed 17.30m in Sheffield to lead world rankings, and could win if he jumps well again. Edwards thinks Idowu needs more international performances to prove himself as Britain's top triple jumper.
llama3.2:3b: Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu can win gold at the European Indoor Championships, citing his recent performance at the British trials as a good starting point. Idowu's ability is undoubted, but consistency and international success are lacking. A victory in Madrid will boost his confidence, according to Edwards.
gemma2:2b: Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu can win gold at the European Indoor Championships after his impressive performance at the British trials. He believes Idowu's consistent performances are limited to domestic competitions, and winning in Madrid will build confidence and self-belief.  The qualifying round is Friday, with the final scheduled for Saturday.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Jonathan Edwards predicts Idowu, a World Outdoor Triple Jump Record holder, to take gold at the European Indoor Championships after finishing 17.30m in his first British trials in Sheffield last month. Edwards hopes his breakthrough at the Manchester Games can lead to a victory at Madrid. The qualifying round of men's triple jump takes place on Friday and is followed by the final on Saturday.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Idowu, tipped by Edwards to win gold at European Indoor Championships, has landed 17.30m in trials and could potentially claim his first World Indoor Championship title. Edwards believes his ability is undoubted but recent performances suggest he can perform better internationally. Idowu needs to improve consistency for a chance of world supremacy. The qualifying round in Madrid represents an opportunity to showcase his credentials as Britain's top triple jumper.
qwen2.5:3b: World outdoor triple jump record holder Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu can win gold at the European Indoor Championships. Idowu, who led world rankings with a 17.30m jump in Sheffield, has yet to achieve major international success despite his ability and talent mainly showcasing in domestic events. Edwards suggests the upcoming European Indoors in Madrid could be an opportunity for Idowu to establish himself as Britain's top triple jumper by proving consistent at an international level. The qualifying round takes place on Friday with the final scheduled for Saturday, featuring no Olympic champion Christian Olsson due to injury.

Jonathan Edwards tips Idowu for Euro gold at European Indoor Championships. Idowu, world triple jump leader and British pundit, claimed to be the runner-up after landing 17.30m in the British trials. Despite not yet winning, he's seen potential through his consistent performances. Edwards believes his ability stands on solid ground but needs to reach international level. The qualifying round in Madrid could give him a chance to prove himself as Britain's top jumper, with Christian Olsson out due to an injury.
tinyllama:1.1b: World outdoor triple jump record holder and BBC commentator Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu has a good chance of winning gold at the European Indoor Championships. The three-time world champion, who led the world triple jump ranking in the wake of his Sheffield triumph in 2019, thinks Idowu's talent and performance potential make him a serious contender for the title. Despite a successful Commonwealth Games silver medal last year, Edwards feels that the London-based athlete still needs to improve and gain more experience at international level. The European Indoor Championships takes place in Madrid from Friday (20 March) until Saturday (21 March). Olson, who qualified on Thursday but will not be taking part due to an injury, will take part in the women's high jump final on Saturday.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Prepare for a thrilling and unexpectedly competitive European Indoors, where reigning world champion Jonathan Edwards believes Phillips Idowu has the potential to break through. This triple jump specialist possesses the talent to win gold if he can make his mark at the high-stakes Madrid meet. The world record leader has already achieved significant success in domestic trials but will have to demonstrate more consistency if he wants to claim top spot in Madrid, where a victory would boost his confidence and self-belief.
